title: (x) Cotey fancy script - ITC Edwardian Script {Nic V}
content:
Can someone ID the attached script font? Thank you.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [cotey.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20060523005015/http:/typophile.com/files/cotey.jpg) | 38.54 KB |
author: evan

comments.content:
My first impression is Edwardian Script ITC

-nic

now I see it, I was looking at a regular version of edwardian, and this was the alternate one - the C didn’t match

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-edwardian-script/](http://web.archive.org/web/20060523005015/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-edwardian-script/)
I have the OT version of this face and the Alt ‘C’ came up when I typed in ‘Cotey’ in FontExplorer, interesting. Glad you figured it out.
